nl.tno.sensorstorm.api.processing

Interface Fetcher

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable

    public interface Fetcher
extends Serializable
    A Fetcher retrieves data from a specific source. It is called from the SensorStormSpout. The spout also takes care of MetaParticle and mapping between Tuples and Particles.

    Every Fetcher must have a FetcherDeclaration annotation, otherwise the Fetcher will be rejected by the SensorStormSpout.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void activate()
      Activate the fetcher.
      void deactivate()
      Deactivate the fetcher.
      DataParticle fetchParticle()
      Main method to return the next particle to be emitted by the spout.
      void prepare(Map stormNativeConfig, nl.tno.storm.configuration.api.ExternalStormConfiguration externalStormConfiguration, backtype.storm.task.TopologyContext context)
      Prepare method for this fetcher.

    • Method Detail

      • prepare

        void prepare(Map stormNativeConfig,
           nl.tno.storm.configuration.api.ExternalStormConfiguration externalStormConfiguration,
           backtype.storm.task.TopologyContext context)
        Prepare method for this fetcher. Initialize streams, open connections, files, etc. It is called from the spout.open method.
        Parameters:
        stormNativeConfig - Native Storm configuration map
        externalStormConfiguration - Reference to the ExternalStormConfiguration
        context - Reference to the TopologyContext

      • activate

        void activate()
        Activate the fetcher. It is called from the spout.activate.

      • deactivate

        void deactivate()
        Deactivate the fetcher. It is called from the spout.deactivate.

      • fetchParticle

        DataParticle fetchParticle()
        Main method to return the next particle to be emitted by the spout. The fetcher should declare its DataParticles types using the FetcherDeclaration annotation.
        Returns:
        Returns the next particle, or null indicating no particle has to be emitted.
